intro: Fumaria malacitana, commonly known as the Malacitana whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Fumaria malacitana is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
